purpose_text.para: Controls sample filtering by events. The overall filter is the logical AND of these filters. For example, if PMSEVFR_EL1.E[3] and PMSEVFR_EL1.E[5] are both set to 1, only samples that have both event 3 (Level 1 unified or data cache refill) and event 5 (TLB walk) set to 1 are recorded.

field_description.para: E[<x>] is the event filter for event <x>. If event <x> is not implemented, or filtering on event <x> is not supported, the corresponding bit is RAZ/WI.
An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event might be recorded as a multi-bit field. In this case, if the corresponding bits of PMSEVFR_EL1 define an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED filter for the event.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0

field_value_description.para: Event <x> is ignored.
Do not record samples that have event <x> == 0.

Data snooped.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Data snooped event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Data snooped event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented and event 23 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Recently fetched.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Recently fetched event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Recently fetched event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented and event 22 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Cache data modified.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Cache data modified event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Cache data modified event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented and event 21 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Level 2 data cache miss.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Level 2 data cache miss event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Level 2 data cache miss event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented and event 20 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Level 2 data cache access.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Level 2 data cache access event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Level 2 data cache access event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented and event 19 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Empty predicate.
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Empty predicate event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Empty predicate event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p1 is implemented and FEAT_SVE is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Partial predicate.
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Partial predicate event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Partial predicate event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p1 is implemented and FEAT_SVE is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Transactional
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Transactional event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Transactional event == 0.

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
E[15] is the event filter for event 15. If event 15 is not implemented, or filtering on event 15 is not supported, the corresponding bit is RAZ/WI.
An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event might be recorded as a multi-bit field. In this case, if the corresponding bits of PMSEVFR_EL1 define an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED filter for the event.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0
E[14] is the event filter for event 14. If event 14 is not implemented, or filtering on event 14 is not supported, the corresponding bit is RAZ/WI.
An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event might be recorded as a multi-bit field. In this case, if the corresponding bits of PMSEVFR_EL1 define an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED filter for the event.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0

An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event might be recorded as a multi-bit field. In this case, if the corresponding bits of PMSEVFR_EL1 define an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED filter for the event.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0
E[12] is the event filter for event 12. If event 12 is not implemented, or filtering on event 12 is not supported, the corresponding bit is RAZ/WI.
An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED event might be recorded as a multi-bit field. In this case, if the corresponding bits of PMSEVFR_EL1 define an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED filter for the event.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0
Alignment.
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Alignment event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Alignment event == 0.

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Remote access.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Remote access event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Remote access event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When (FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented or filtering on event 10 is optionally supported) and event 10 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Last Level cache miss.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Last Level cache miss event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Last Level cache miss event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When (FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented or filtering on event 9 is optionally supported) and event 9 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Last Level cache access.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Last Level cache access event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Last Level cache access event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When (FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented or filtering on event 8 is optionally supported) and event 8 is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Mispredicted.
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Mispredicted event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Mispredicted event == 0.

field_description.para: Not taken.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Not taken event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Not taken event == 0.

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
TLB walk.
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: TLB walk event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the TLB walk event == 0.

field_description.para: TLB access.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: TLB access event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the TLB access event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented or filtering on event 4 is optionally supported

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Level 1 data or unified cache refill.
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Level 1 data or unified cache refill event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Level 1 data or unified cache refill event == 0.

field_description.para: Level 1 data cache access.
This field is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

field_value_description.para: Level 1 data cache access event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Level 1 data cache access event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When FEAT_SPEv1p4 is implemented or filtering on event 2 is optionally supported

field_description.para: Reserved, RAZ/WI.
Architecturally executed.
When the PE supports sampling of speculative instructions:
This bit is ignored by the PE when PMSFCR_EL1.FE == 0.

If the PE does not support the sampling of speculative instructions, or always discards the sample record for speculative instructions, this bit reads as an UNKNOWN value and the PE ignores its value.

field_value_description.para: Architecturally executed event is ignored.
Do not record samples that have the Architecturally executed event == 0.

field.fields_condition: When the PE supports sampling of speculative instructions

field_description.para: Reserved, UNKNOWN.
Reserved, RAZ/WI.

ps.name: MRS
MSRregister
